channel.title: 4chan threads from multiple boards
channel.description: Threads from multiple boards with more than 30 replies

item.title: [103] Gamers confirmed retards
item.description:
CEO, Creative Director and Lead Developer Thomas Mahler of Moon Game Studios - the Developers of Ori and the Blind Forest, a beloved and widely popular indie title and more recently, No Rest for the Wicked, confirmed in a recent post what should be extremely obvious.

Gamers are fucking retarded.
>We see a lot of players only putting points into the supporter attributes like health, stamina, focus or equip load while barely putting any points into their main attributes and then they wonder why their character isn't getting stronger. We assumed that because players can clearly see their weapon damage going up as they put points into STR if they have a STR weapon equipped, they'd connect the dots.
>We see a lot of players using a STR weapon while putting a lot of their points into DEX or other main attributes, which essentially results in players having insanely underpowered builds without understanding why.
This problem is so extreme they have to rework such a basic core system of the game to be mouthbreather proof because of how prevalent the retardation is in the game.

Picture is proof for those who don't want to go to xitter.
x.com/thomasmahler/status/1920145150090604952
Link for people who want source.

Original filename: file.png
item.author: Anonymous

item.title: [ 53] It's not deferred renderings fault. UE5 just looks like sh!t and devs don't help it
item.description:
Horrible ending on this thread: >>709150187

Both of these games use deferred rendering. The difference between the two is that UE5 games renders hair with dithering inside the deferred textures: https://youtu.be/NxjhtkzuH9M?t=576

Cryengine forward renders non-dithered hair on top of the completely lit deferred rendering: https://youtu.be/SYUL1tt_olk?t=614 (lighting)

Then hair is forward rendered on top of the deferred lit scene: https://youtu.be/SYUL1tt_olk?t=628

https://youtu.be/SYUL1tt_olk?t=652
It's 60 microseconds more (basically nothing) to render CryEngine's way. And apparently some hair is rendered first in the deffered stage according to the dude in the video.

UE5 has the ability to forward render objects after the deferred lighting too. Devs are just too lazy/incompetent to do it that way in unreal.

Original filename: chan.png
item.author: Anonymous

item.title: [104] Why do you guys hate Square Enix so much? Literally all they want to do is make
item.description:
Why do you guys hate Square Enix so much? Literally all they want to do is make fun Japanese video gamey weeb video games, basically like the 1990’s but in 4K. They are not pozzed, they aren’t pushing an agenda. Arguably the only wrong thing they did was force Tifa to wear a bra (for her posture).

item.title: [381] /nrl/ - Rugby League General - Thursday Night Footy - round
item.description:
Fast week edition

NRL
>GAME 1
Parramatta Eels v Redcliffe Dolphins
7:50pm AEST on Fox, Kayo and Ch9
Commbank Stadium, Sydney
1.71-2.15
>Round 10 begins with Mitch Moses trying to cement his Blues spot for this year, while one of the NRL's excitement machines looks to spark the visitors. Parramatta hit rock bottom after a 28-18 loss to Cronulla, a game in which they managed to score 12 of their points while the Sharks were a man down. The result sees the Eels anchored to the bottom of the ladder. The Dolphins fared little better, conceding seven tries in a 36-26 defeat to the Roosters. Their woes on the road continue, having now lost eight straight matches outside of Queensland. The Dolphins emphatically beat the Eels 44-16 last season in Darwin.
Eels 1-12 3.00
Eels 13+ 3.30
Dolphins 1-12 3.25
Dolphins 13+ 4.90
Eels -2.5 2.00 Dolphins +2.5 1.82

item.description:
Laughing At DLSS Schizo And His Shitty PC Edition

>UPGRADE & BUILD ADVICE.
Post build list or current specs including MONITOR: https://pcpartpicker.com/
Provide specific use cases.
State BUDGET and COUNTRY or you will NOT be helped.
Building guide: https://wiki.installgentoo.com/index.php/Build_a_PC

>CASE (from $ to $$$)
mATX: Asus Prime AP201, Lian Li A3, O11 Air Mini
ATX: Phanteks XT PRO (ULTRA), Montech AIR 903 Base/MAX, Lian Li Lancool 207, Antec C8, Antec Flux Pro
AVOID: NXZT, 'Silent' cases, fanless cases, Corsair 6500

>CPU
Budget: 9600X, 7600X, 7500f
Gaming: AMD X3D
Workstation: 9950X, 7950X
AVOID Shittel

>COOLER
AIO: Best Value: Thermalright Frozen Prism, Premium LCD: Lian Li Galahad II LCD
Double towers: Thermalright Phantom Spirit 120 SE, Noctua NH-D15 G2
ITX/>42mm RAM: Scythe Fuma 3/TR AXP120-X67

>MOTHERBOARD
ASRock B850M-X, ASRock B850 LiveMixer WiFi, ASRock X870 Pro RS, ASRock Phantom Gaming X870E Nova WiFi

>RAM
DDR4: 2x16GB 3200CL16. Budget, 2x8GB
DDR5: 2x16GB 6000CL30
Workstation/high end: consider 2x32GB

>SSD (OS drive)
Budget: Silicon Power UD90
Mid range: SN770
Premium: SN850X
Flagship: Sabrent Rocket 5

>GPU
1080p: No VRAM: RTX 5060 and RTX 5060 TI 8GB, Fake Frames: RTX 5060 TI 16GB, Real Performance: RX 9060 XT
1440p: Fake Frames: RTX 5070 TI, Real Performance: RX 9070 XT, Budget: RX 9060 XT
4K: Fire Starter: RTX 5090, Scam Enjoyer: RTX 5080, Affordable: 9070 XT
Workstation: AVOID AMD cards
Value For Money: AVOID Ngreedia cards
ALWAYS pair AMD GPUs with AMD CPUs for SAM https://imgur.com/a/7XecPGL

>PSU
PSU buying guide:
https://hwbusters.com/best_picks/best-atxv3-pcie5-ready-psus-picks-hardware-busters/

>MONITOR
https://pcmonitors.info/recommendations/

>OS
Activate Windows @ >>>/g/fwt

>CASE FANS
Meta: Case with good stock PWM fans
Mid range: Arctic P12/P14 (Max) (5-pack)
High end: Noctua NF-A12x25, Noctua NF-A14x25 G2

item.title: [ 78] /tcg/ Trading Card Game General
item.description:
Why So Cirrus Edition

>I want to learn the game, where do I begin?
Download PTCGL at https://tcg.pokemon.com/en-us/tcgl
The game has a quick tutorial and a bunch of decent decks to get you started against other beginners or against the AI. Some of those decks are very close to meta too. You can also go to your local game store and see if people are playing Pokémon.

>I know how to play, how do I make my own deck?
You have a decent beginner's guide at https://www.justinbasil.com/guide
There's also the old /tcg/ guide at https://imgur.com/a/W4NkOu6
After that, look up meta decks and try to reverse engineer them to see how things work.

>Where to find meta decks?
For big irl events, go to https://limitlesstcg.com/decks
For online events, go to https://play.limitlesstcg.com/decks?game=PTCG
For japanese events, go to https://pokecabook.com/archives/1417

Previous thread: >>57755719

Old /tcg/ pastebin: https://pastebin.com/Ge95YuMA

Original filename: 126958494_p0.png
item.author: Anonymous

item.title: [124] /dmp/ - Digital Music Production
item.description:
>Wikis
https://dmpdoc.neocities.org/
https://mu-sic-production.fandom.com/wiki//mu/sic_Production_Wiki

>/g/ makes a 15th album
Theme: Trackers only
Title: Tracker Resurgance [sic]
Deadline: 10th of May, 11:00 UTC
Listening party: 11th of May, 20:00 UTC
Submissions for this theme must include a tracker file in addition to audio.
The following tracker formats are allowed: .xm, .mod, .it, as well as formats that chiptune trackers export to, such as lsdj
>Check out these trackers to get started
https://milkytracker.org/
https://openmpt.org/
https://github.com/tildearrow/furnace

Next album: Shitposting fundamentals volume 2

>IMPORTANT! READ THIS BEFORE SUBMITTING:
Upload the file somewhere, preferably in a lossless format, and post the link here. If you want to update your track, make a new post.
Include the song title in the post, and make it clear that your song is a submission for the album.
Optionally you may include cover art for your track, but please state that the image attached is the cover art or it won't be included. Artist names won't be included.
Songs that contain anything against YouTube's policies won't be uploaded on YT, but will still be added to the album.
All tracks will be normalised to -14 LUFS in the release. If your song has a lot of dynamic range and you want to keep it, just say so in the submission.

>Where can I hear the previous albums?
https://rentry.org/dmpalbums

Previous: >>105076341

Original filename: stuff.png

item.title: [221] /ptg/ - Private Trackers General
item.description:
>Not sure what private trackers are all about?
A private tracker is a torrent website that provides the same functionality as a public tracker but is invite-only. Each member share common goals: collecting, preserving and discussing media.

>Have a question?
- FAQ https://archive.is/UVQkn
- WIKI https://igwiki.lyci.de/wiki/Private_trackers
- STUDY https://www.cambridge.org/core/services/aop-cambridge-core/content/view/2F379FE0CB50DF502F0075119FD3E060
- SPREADSHEET https://hdvinnie.github.io/Private-Trackers-Spreadsheet/
- TEN CURRY COMMANDMENTS https://pastebin.com/raw/dBbdE73M
- TEN NEON COMMANDMENTS https://pastebin.com/raw/Ud2pGYaE
- IRC irc://irc.sageru.org#ptg

Use >>>/g/ptg as a link to find the /ptg/ thread.

Remember the following:
>READ THE OP BEFORE MAKING A FUCKING QUESTION YOU RETARDED FAGGOT

item.title: [ 50] Should bitcoin have tail emission?
item.description:
With coinbase outputs getting cut in half all of the time, we'll eventually reach a point where mining is completely subsidized by fees. It looks like this could result in miners losing their hats and a 51% attack.

Peter Todd points to tail emission (constant emission of bitcoin, for example constant 1BTC block reward forever, instead of a geometric distribution with halvenings) as a possible solution. It provides constant security for the network and the actual effect on inflation (the inflation as a % of total supply) decreases asymptotically to zero as time goes on. It's already used in monero and dogecoin, and they haven't collapsed yet.

What do you think, anon?
Will bitcoiners ever move beyond the 21 gorrillion coins cap?
If not, will bitcoin implode in like 10 years due to selfish mining attacks?

Original filename: Screenshot 2025-05-06 at 04-01-47 Surprisingly Tail Emission Is Not Inflationary.png

item.title: [155] Trump lies with another big fat lie
item.description:
Trump continues his regressive propaganda campaign with more lies about foreign government deals, using excuses paid for by billionaires
https://www.motherjones.com/politics/2025/05/trump-org-foreign-real-estate-deals-unconstitutional-business-ethics-conflict-interest/
Trump Promised No New Business Deals With Foreign Governments. He Lied.
His family’s real estate deals put the president in direct conflict with the Constitution.

released an “ethics agreement” detailing how he would handle his personal business interests while in the White House. It is remarkably weak and does not require Trump to divest any of his holdings. Unlike a similar agreement for his first term, it does not prohibit the Trump Organization from striking new deals abroad while Trump is president. Instead, it simply prohibits the Trump Organization from striking deals directly with foreign governments.

Trump’s second-term ethics agreement is such a permissive document that it is challenging to find a way to violate it. But three months into his presidency, Trump has found a way.

Last Thursday, the Trump Organization struck a deal to build a $5.5 billion Trump International Golf Club in Qatar. To develop the project, the Trump Organization is partnering with Dar Global, a Saudi Arabian company, and Qatari Diar, a company owned by the Qatari government. Qatari Diar was established by Qatar’s sovereign wealth fund in 2005. Its stated purpose is to “coordinate the country’s real estate development priorities.”

Original filename: Trump-Excuses-58b8dc005f9b58af5c8f8e91.jpg
item.author: Anonymous

item.title: [192] /fwt/ - Friendly Windows Thread
item.description:
FAQ:
>How do I activate Windows?
github.com/massgravel/Microsoft-Activation-Scripts
HWID2 generates and registers a permanent legitimate license on MS's activation servers
Usage: paste into Powershell, run.
irm https://get.activated.win | iex

>and Office?
Same method, use Ohook
You can also use Office.com if your needs are very minimal
or try OnlyOffice/LibreOffice and set it to save in MSOffice file formats

>What version should I install?
W10 Enterprise IoT LTSC 2021
>Binary identical to Enterprise except no MS Store or apps
>Can install MS Store from cmd with: wsreset -i
>Alternatively use winget for apps
>Preinstalled with: Edge & Win32 system apps
>10 years support on "IoT LTSC", 5 for "LTSC"
>Manual version upgrades
IoT LTSC 2022: https://pastebin.com/rHcgvYS7

W11 Enterprise IoT LTSC 2024
>Same as W10 version except:
>UI written in React Native aka JavaScript including: Start, Taskbar and Explorer that lags even on i9s
>Use only if you fell for the 12th+ gen Intel meme and need the new CPU scheduler
>Wait for IoT LTSC 2027 if you can

W10/W11 Home/Pro/Education/Enterprise/Enterprise IoT
>Preinstalled with: Edge, Win32 system apps, MS Store, OneDrive, Weather, Movies, Music, Candy Crush, etc
>Auto-reinstalls apps on feature updates
>1.5-3 years support
>Forced version upgrades

>ISOs:
Windows IoT LTSC https://pastebin.com/ywkasnhM
Windows https://pastebin.com/nUMgAr0b
Office https://pastebin.com/G8w5qu6z

>Should I debloat / build my own ISO?
If you need to ask, then no.
If you know what you're doing:
https://pastebin.com/S5VKBirt

>Portable programs & reinstall-proofing
https://pastebin.com/Zh7WSbJ2

>Useful programs (new installs, essentials, utilities, adobe, etc)
https://pastebin.com/hN8nnwns

>I miss Windows##
OpenShell/RetroBar/WinClassic/StartIsBack


>LTSC Install Guides
https://rentry.org/windowsinstallguide
https://rentry.org/concisewin10
https://rentry.org/ltsc

https://rentry.org/fwtarchive

>language is 50 years old
>still faster than your Rust
>portable across a toaster and a mainframe
>not OOP, not garbage-collected, not safe™
>just works

WIKI: https://igwiki.lyci.de/wiki//chad/

Don't know how to write C? Start here:
K&R: https://files.catbox.moe/rfhegv.pdf
K&R with modern comments https://www.cc4e.com/book/

alias c89='gcc -std=c89 -pedantic -Wall -Werror -Wextra'

XinY: https://learnxinyminutes.com/c/
KING: https://files.catbox.moe/a875c2.pdf
Modern C: https://files.catbox.moe/xeb93p.pdf
https://learnxinyminutes.com/c/

Have an in-depth question, or deep wondering? Ask here, or see the standards:
C89: https://libgen.is/book/index.php?md5=12FCC3ACEBF54480768E7417485E802F
C99: https://libgen.is/book/index.php?md5=FF8DC9D8F109111A91A70CC29FB16168

GDB Cheatsheet: https://darkdust.net/files/GDB%20Cheat%20Sheet.pdf

Learn Makefiles: https://makefiletutorial.com/

C -> asm: https://godbolt.org/

item.title: [ 34] Hey voyagers, The sticky probably needs to be updated, I'll keep the thread
item.description:
Hey voyagers,

The sticky probably needs to be updated, I'll keep the thread open for suggestions:

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

/trv/ is a slow board, so don't expect immediate responses. CHECK THE CATALOG – you might find threads already discussing topics you're interested in.

Before asking for suggestions, tell /trv/ about your:
>Budget
>Interests
>Level of understanding of the local language(s)
This makes it easier to give quality advice. Of course, keep your posts travel related.

For all other matters:
General culture questions >>>/int/
Politics discussion >>>/pol/
Transportation discussion >>>/n/
Outdoors-related discussion >>>/out/

For more information about safety, planning and other miscellaneous topics, check out the pastebin:

GENERAL INFO:
https://pastebin.com/yR1SAr3s

Note: Discussions of prostitution or sex tourism are not permitted on /trv/.

item.title: [157] Freediving / Spearfishing
item.description:
General thread for freediving and/or spearfishing, since I don't see one mentioning either.

My personal questions:
I've been thinking about taking a certification course so I can learn to do these things correctly and safely. I'm probably happy just doing the diving, but spearfishing seems like an easy and practical extension. I only casually skindive and rod-and-reel fish at the moment. Does anyone have experience taking such a course?
I know I'll need my own gear early on, but each instructor I can find seems to have their own equipment shops, so I imagine they wouldn't be impartial about the quality of other gear on the market. I live on the Pacific coast of the US, so I see that a 7 mm open cell wetsuit is strongly recommended. What good/bad features should I look out for on wetsuits and other equipment? For non-competitive diving, carbon fiber fins are almost certainly not worth the price, right?

Original filename: 1719043731130996.jpg
item.author: Anonymous
